CVE-2014-0001.title: MySQL: Multiple vulnerabilities — GLSA 201409-04
CVE-2014-0001.subTitle: Multiple vulnerabilities have been found in MySQL, worst of which allows local attackers to escalate their privileges.
CVE-2014-0001.background: MySQL is a popular multi-threaded, multi-user SQL server.
CVE-2014-0001.body: Multiple vulnerabilities have been discovered in MySQL. Please review the CVE identifiers referenced below for details.
CVE-2014-0001.extra: A local attacker could possibly gain escalated privileges. A remote attacker could send a specially crafted SQL query, possibly resulting in a Denial of Service condition. A remote attacker could entice a user to connect to specially crafted MySQL server, possibly resulting in execution of arbitrary code with the privileges of the process.

CVE-2014-0028.title: libvirt: Multiple vulnerabilities — GLSA 201412-04
CVE-2014-0028.subTitle: Multiple vulnerabilities have been found in libvirt, worst of which allows context-dependent attackers to escalate privileges.
CVE-2014-0028.background: libvirt is a C toolkit for manipulating virtual machines.
CVE-2014-0028.body: Multiple vulnerabilities have been discovered in libvirt. Please review the CVE identifiers referenced below for details.
CVE-2014-0028.extra: A remote attacker may be able to cause a Denial of Service or cause information leakage. A local attacker may be able to escalate privileges, cause a Denial of Service or possibly execute arbitrary code.

CVE-2014-0032.title: Subversion, Serf: Multiple Vulnerabilities — GLSA 201610-05
CVE-2014-0032.subTitle: Multiple vulnerabilities have been found in Subversion and Serf, the worst of which could lead to execution of arbitrary code.
CVE-2014-0032.background: Subversion is a version control system intended to eventually replace CVS. Like CVS, it has an optional client-server architecture (where the server can be an Apache server running mod_svn, or an ssh program as in CVS’s :ext: method). In addition to supporting the features found in CVS, Subversion also provides support for moving and copying files and directories.
CVE-2014-0032.body: The serf library is a high performance C-based HTTP client library built upon the Apache Portable Runtime (APR) library.
CVE-2014-0032.extra: Multiple vulnerabilities have been discovered in Subversion and Serf. Please review the CVE identifiers referenced below for details

CVE-2014-0098.title: Apache HTTP Server: Multiple vulnerabilities — GLSA 201408-12
CVE-2014-0098.subTitle: Multiple vulnerabilities have been discovered in Apache HTTP Server, the worse of which could lead to execution of arbitrary code or a Denial of Service condition
CVE-2014-0098.background: Apache HTTP Server is one of the most popular web servers on the Internet.
CVE-2014-0098.body: Multiple vulnerabilities have been found in Apache HTTP Server. Please review the CVE identifiers referenced below for details.
CVE-2014-0098.extra: A remote attacker could send a specially crafted request to possibly execute arbitrary code, cause Denial of Service, or obtain sensitive information.

CVE-2014-0107.title: Xalan-Java: Arbitrary code execution — GLSA 201604-02
CVE-2014-0107.subTitle: Insufficient constraints in Apache's Xalan-Java might allow remote attackers to execute arbitrary code and load arbitrary classes.
CVE-2014-0107.background: Xalan-Java is an XSLT processor for transforming XML documents into HTML, text, or other XML document types.
CVE-2014-0107.body: The TransformerFactory in Apache Xalan-Java does not properly restrict access to certain properties when FEATURE_SECURE_PROCESSING is enabled. This can also be exploited via a Java property that is bound to the XSLT 1.0 system-property function.
CVE-2014-0107.extra: A remote attacker could inject specially crafted XSLT properties resulting in the execution of arbitrary code with the privileges of the process.

CVE-2014-0114.title: Commons-BeanUtils: Arbitrary code execution — GLSA 201607-09
CVE-2014-0114.subTitle: Apache Commons BeanUtils does not properly suppress the class property, which could lead to the remote execution of arbitrary code.
CVE-2014-0114.background: Commons-beanutils provides easy-to-use wrappers around Reflection and Introspection APIs
CVE-2014-0114.body: Apache Commons BeanUtils does not suppress the class property, which allows for the manipulation of the ClassLoader.
CVE-2014-0114.extra: Remote attackers could potentially execute arbitrary code with the privileges of the process.

CVE-2014-0118.title: Apache: Multiple vulnerabilities — GLSA 201504-03
CVE-2014-0118.subTitle: Multiple vulnerabilities have been found in Apache HTTP Server, the worst of which could lead to arbitrary code execution.
CVE-2014-0118.background: Apache HTTP Server is one of the most popular web servers on the Internet.
CVE-2014-0118.body: Multiple vulnerabilities have been discovered in Apache HTTP Server. Please review the CVE identifiers referenced below for details.
CVE-2014-0118.extra: A remote attacker may be able to execute arbitrary code or cause a Denial of Service condition.

CVE-2014-0172.title: elfutils: Heap-based buffer overflow — GLSA 201612-32
CVE-2014-0172.subTitle: A heap-based buffer overflow vulnerability in elfutils might allow remote attackers to execute arbitrary code.
CVE-2014-0172.background: Elfutils provides a library and utilities to access, modify and analyse ELF objects.
CVE-2014-0172.body: An integer overflow, in the check_section function of dwarf_begin_elf.c, in the libdw library can lead to a heap-based buffer overflow.
CVE-2014-0172.extra: A remote attacker could entice a user to open a specially crafted file, possibly resulting in the execution of arbitrary code with the privileges of the process or a Denial of Service condition.

CVE-2014-0179.title: libvirt: Multiple vulnerabilities — GLSA 201412-04

CVE-2014-0179.background: libvirt is a C toolkit for manipulating virtual machines.
CVE-2014-0179.body: Multiple vulnerabilities have been discovered in libvirt. Please review the CVE identifiers referenced below for details.
CVE-2014-0179.extra: A remote attacker may be able to cause a Denial of Service or cause information leakage. A local attacker may be able to escalate privileges, cause a Denial of Service or possibly execute arbitrary code.

CVE-2014-0195.title: OpenSSL: Multiple vulnerabilities — GLSA 201407-05
CVE-2014-0195.subTitle: Multiple vulnerabilities have been found in OpenSSL, possibly allowing remote attackers to execute arbitrary code.
CVE-2014-0195.background: OpenSSL is an Open Source toolkit implementing the Secure Sockets Layer (SSL v2/v3) and Transport Layer Security (TLS v1) as well as a general purpose cryptography library.
CVE-2014-0195.body: Multiple vulnerabilities have been discovered in OpenSSL. Please review the OpenSSL Security Advisory [05 Jun 2014] and the CVE identifiers referenced below for details.
CVE-2014-0195.extra: A remote attacker could send specially crafted DTLS fragments to an OpenSSL DTLS client or server to possibly execute arbitrary code with the privileges of the process using OpenSSL.

CVE-2014-0239.title: Samba: Multiple vulnerabilities — GLSA 201502-15
CVE-2014-0239.subTitle: Multiple vulnerabilities have been found in Samba, the worst of which allowing a context-dependent attacker to bypass intended file restrictions, cause a Denial of Service or execute arbitrary code.
CVE-2014-0239.background: Samba is a suite of SMB and CIFS client/server programs.
CVE-2014-0239.body: Multiple vulnerabilities have been discovered in Samba. Please review the CVE identifiers referenced below for details.
CVE-2014-0239.extra: A context-dependent attacker may be able to execute arbitrary code, cause a Denial of Service condition, bypass intended file restrictions, or obtain sensitive information.

CVE-2014-0250.title: FreeRDP: User-assisted execution of arbitrary code — GLSA 201412-18
CVE-2014-0250.subTitle: An integer overflow in FreeRDP couuld result in execution of arbitrary code or Denial of Service.
CVE-2014-0250.background: FreeRDP is a free implementation of the remote desktop protocol.
CVE-2014-0250.body: FreeRDP does not properly validate user-supplied input, which could lead to an integer overflow in the xf_Pointer_New() function.
CVE-2014-0250.extra: A remote attacker could execute arbitrary code with the privileges of the process or cause Denial of Service.

CVE-2014-0475.title: GNU C Library: Multiple vulnerabilities — GLSA 201602-02
CVE-2014-0475.subTitle: Multiple vulnerabilities have been found in the GNU C library, the worst allowing for remote execution of arbitrary code.
CVE-2014-0475.background: The GNU C library is the standard C library used by Gentoo Linux systems.
CVE-2014-0475.body: Multiple vulnerabilities have been discovered in the GNU C Library:
CVE-2014-0475.extra: Please review the CVEs referenced below for additional vulnerabilities that had already been fixed in previous versions of sys-libs/glibc, for which we have not issued a GLSA before.

CVE-2014-0476.title: chkrootkit: Local privilege escalation — GLSA 201709-05
CVE-2014-0476.subTitle: A vulnerability in chkrootkit may allow local users to gain root privileges.
CVE-2014-0476.background: chkrootkit is a tool to locally check for signs of a rootkit.
CVE-2014-0476.body: When /tmp is mounted without the noexec option chkrootkit will execute files in /tmp with root privileges.
CVE-2014-0476.extra: A local attacker could possibly execute arbitrary code with root privileges.

CVE-2014-0498.title: Adobe Flash Player: Multiple vulnerabilities — GLSA 201405-04
CVE-2014-0498.subTitle: Multiple vulnerabilities have been found in Adobe Flash Player, the worst of which could result in execution of arbitrary code.
CVE-2014-0498.background: The Adobe Flash Player is a renderer for the SWF file format, which is commonly used to provide interactive websites.
CVE-2014-0498.body: Multiple vulnerabilities have been discovered in Adobe Flash Player. Please review the CVE identifiers referenced below for details.
CVE-2014-0498.extra: A remote attacker could entice a user to open a specially crafted SWF file using Adobe Flash Player, possibly resulting in execution of arbitrary code with the privileges of the process or a Denial of Service condition. Furthermore, a remote attacker may be able to bypass the Same Origin Policy or read the clipboard via unspecified vectors.

CVE-2014-1478.title: Mozilla Products: Multiple vulnerabilities — GLSA 201504-01
CVE-2014-1478.subTitle: Multiple vulnerabilities have been found in Mozilla Firefox, Thunderbird, and SeaMonkey, the worst of which may allow user-assisted execution of arbitrary code.
CVE-2014-1478.background: Mozilla Firefox is an open-source web browser and Mozilla Thunderbird an open-source email client, both from the Mozilla Project. The SeaMonkey project is a community effort to deliver production-quality releases of code derived from the application formerly known as the ‘Mozilla Application Suite’.
CVE-2014-1478.body: Multiple vulnerabilities have been discovered in Firefox, Thunderbird, and SeaMonkey. Please review the CVE identifiers referenced below for details.
CVE-2014-1478.extra: A remote attacker could entice a user to view a specially crafted web page or email, possibly resulting in execution of arbitrary code or a Denial of Service condition. Furthermore, a remote attacker may be able to perform Man-in-the-Middle attacks, obtain sensitive information, spoof the address bar, conduct clickjacking attacks, bypass security restrictions and protection mechanisms, or have other unspecified impact.

CVE-2014-1576.background: Mozilla Firefox is an open-source web browser and Mozilla Thunderbird an open-source email client, both from the Mozilla Project. The SeaMonkey project is a community effort to deliver production-quality releases of code derived from the application formerly known as the ‘Mozilla Application Suite’.
CVE-2014-1576.body: Multiple vulnerabilities have been discovered in Firefox, Thunderbird, and SeaMonkey. Please review the CVE identifiers referenced below for details.
CVE-2014-1576.extra: A remote attacker could entice a user to view a specially crafted web page or email, possibly resulting in execution of arbitrary code or a Denial of Service condition. Furthermore, a remote attacker may be able to perform Man-in-the-Middle attacks, obtain sensitive information, spoof the address bar, conduct clickjacking attacks, bypass security restrictions and protection mechanisms, or have other unspecified impact.

CVE-2014-9497.body: An issue has been found in mpg123 when decoding specifically crafted MP3 file, that causes a heap-based buffer overflow.

CVE-2014-9765.title: xdelta: User-assisted execution of arbitrary code — GLSA 201701-40
CVE-2014-9765.subTitle: A buffer overflow in xdelta might allow remote attackers to execute arbitrary code.
CVE-2014-9765.background: Xdelta is a C library and command-line tool for delta compression using VCDIFF/RFC 3284 streams.
CVE-2014-9765.body: A buffer overflow can be triggered within xdelta when ran against a malicious input file.
CVE-2014-9765.extra: A remote attacker could coerce the victim to run xdelta against a malicious input file. This may be leveraged by an attacker to crash xdelta and gain control of program execution.

CVE-2014-9862.title: Binary diff: Heap-based buffer overflow — GLSA 202003-44
CVE-2014-9862.subTitle: A heap-based buffer overflow in Binary diff might allow remote attackers to execute arbitrary code.
CVE-2014-9862.background: bsdiff and bspatch are tools for building and applying patches to binary files.
CVE-2014-9862.body: It was discovered that the implementation of bspatch did not check for a negative value on numbers of bytes read from the diff and extra streams.
CVE-2014-9862.extra: A remote attacker could entice a user to apply a specially crafted patch using bspatch, possibly resulting in execution of arbitrary code with the privileges of the process or a Denial of Service condition.
